title.narrative: Protect vulnerable women, men, girls and boys through provision of integrated services

description.narrative: This project is aiming at supporting the livelihood of the communities in Former Apuk West (Ajogo). Specially the internal displaced persons in former Apuk West County. There are an estimated 35,000 displaced household that do not have food, shelter and other basic needs. Within the displaced people majority are women, children and elderly one who are unable to support themselves through any means to improve their living. DMI has designed this project to provide humanitarian support to this vulnerable people as well as agricultural tools and seeds to encourage self-reliance where this group can depend on their own grown products in some years to come. As the situation is somehow improving in the State there are still sporadic cases which are still creating fear among IDPs to return to their respective areas and as a result many people are still in need of humanitarian support. Through this project; the provision of food shall assist them as a short term program to allow the IDPs feed their families. While provision of tools and seeds shall be a long term solution to the food security in their respective villages in Ajogo. After the end of this project, the IDPs will be able to meet their basic survival needs if they are equipped with seeds and agricultural tools.
